questions.question: What happens when the frequency of the tuning fork does not match the resonant frequency of the Helmholtz resonator?

answers.a: The air inside the resonator vibrates, producing less sound
answers.b: The air inside the resonator does not vibrate, producing any sound
answers.c: The sound produced by the tuning fork is amplified by the resonator
answers.d: The resonant frequency of the resonator is adjusted to match the frequency of the tuning fork

questions.question: What does the resonant frequency of a Helmholtz resonator dependent on?

answers.a: The size and shape of the cavity and neck
answers.b: The frequency of the tone generator
answers.c: The frequency of the microphone used to measure the sound
answers.d: The frequency of the tuning fork
